argumentText:
From #P_main_e2.7 with $x$ replaced by $yxy^{-1}$, one has

$${\ell({yxy^{-1}})} \leq \frac{{\ell({y x^n y^{-1}})} }{n} + { c}$$
whenever $n$ is a power of two.  On the other hand, from #P_main_e2.6 and the #(T_qhf, 'triangle inequality') one has

$${\ell({ y x^n y^{-1} })} \leq {\ell({y})} + n {\ell({x})} + {\ell({y^{-1}})}$$
and thus

$${\ell({yxy^{-1}})} \leq {\ell({x})} + { c} + \frac{{\ell({y})} + {\ell({y^{-1}})} { - c}}{n}.$$

Sending $n \to \infty$, we obtain the claim.
